title: Current density - J equals ar-squared from 0 to R

content.question: The cross section of a conducting cylinder has a radius <math alttext="uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>, as shown in the figure. The cylinder has a current parallel to its central axis and with a nonuniform current density <math alttext="J of lowercase r, equals a times lowercase r squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>J</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>r</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>, where <math alttext="lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> is the distance from the central axis and <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>a</mi></math> is a constant. Which of the following integrals is the total current in the cylinder?

choices.label: <math alttext="the integral from 0 to uppercase R, of, open parenthesis, a times lowercase r squared, close parenthesis, d lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><munderover><mo>∫</mo><mn>0</mn><mi>R</mi></munderover><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>r</mi></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the integral from 0 to uppercase R, of, open parenthesis, 2 pi a times lowercase r cubed, close parenthesis, d lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><munderover><mo>∫</mo><mn>0</mn><mi>R</mi></munderover><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>a</mi><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>r</mi></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the integral from 0 to uppercase R, of, open parenthesis, pi a times lowercase r to the fourth power, close parenthesis, d lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><munderover><mo>∫</mo><mn>0</mn><mi>R</mi></munderover><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>π</mi><mi>a</mi><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>4</mn></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>r</mi></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the integral from 0 to uppercase R, of, open parenthesis, 2 pi a times uppercase R squared, times lowercase r, close parenthesis, d lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><munderover><mo>∫</mo><mn>0</mn><mi>R</mi></munderover><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>a</mi><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mi>r</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>r</mi></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the integral from 0 to uppercase R, of, open parenthesis, 2 pi a times lowercase r cubed, close parenthesis, d lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><munderover><mo>∫</mo><mn>0</mn><mi>R</mi></munderover><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>a</mi><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>r</mi></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
